sample.title: Dictionary attack on the Double Columnar Transposition Cipher
sample.description: This template shows a dictionary attack on the double columnar transposition cipher using the IDP Analysis component.
sample.title: Wörterbuchangriff auf die doppelte Spaltentransposition
sample.description: Diese Vorlage zeigt einen Wörterbuchangriff auf die doppelte Spaltentransposition unter Verwendung der Komponente IDP-Analyse.

replacement.value: This template demonstrates a new attack on a ciphertext encrypted with the {b double columnar transposition (DCT)}. It makes use of the {\b IDP (Index of digraphic potential)} method developed by {\b George Lasry} in 2013, when he successfully solved the famous DCT challenge from {\b Klaus Schmeh}.\line\line A DCT consists of two {\b single-columnar transpositions (SCT)}, each having its own key. The success of the IDP method relies on the fact that it can provide a measurement of the quality of the second key without knowing the first key. By calculating the IDP score for each potential keyphrase in a dictionary, the IDP Analysis component is able to determine a promising candidate. It then undoes the second SCT that results from this keyphrase and produces an intermediate ciphertext, which is basically just a SCT and can easily be solved in a second step with a classic hill climbing attack.

If you want to analyze your own ciphertexts and the IDP analysis component does not find the correct key phrase in the provided dictionary, you should try using a different dictionary. The following link is a good source for dictionaries: {\b http://www.ngrams.info/download_coca.asp}
